meanings.definition: A descendant or follower of a notable person or group.
meanings.sent1: The epigons of the great leader continued his legacy.
meanings.sent2: The epigons of the famous artist carried on his artistic style.
meanings.sent3: The epigons of the chef tried to recreate his famous dish but failed comically.
meanings.sent4: The epigons of the legendary warrior were brave but lacked his skill in battle.
meanings.sent5: The epigons of the renowned scientist were eager to learn and innovate.

meanings.sent1: She was often seen as an epigons of the popular singer, copying her style.

meanings.sent4: The student was like an epigons of his teacher, following his every move.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is considered inferior or unworthy.
meanings.sent1: He was treated as an epigons by his peers, always seen as less capable.
meanings.sent2: The old car was an epigons compared to the sleek new models on the market.
meanings.sent3: The small town was often viewed as an epigons of the bustling city life.
meanings.sent4: The plain dress felt like an epigons next to the glamorous gowns at the party.
meanings.sent5: The basic phone seemed like an epigons when compared to the latest smartphone technology.
